warn no-orphans: src/lib/claude-commands.ts

commitMessage:
refactor(context): remove session fallback magic and consolidate session management

## What Changed
- Removed session fallback from /hodge command (context.ts:90)
- Consolidated SessionManager into ContextManager as single source of truth
- Deleted src/lib/session-manager.ts and associated tests (200+ lines removed)
- Updated 4 files to use ContextManager: explore-service.ts, context.ts, status.ts, hodge-md-context-gatherer.ts
- Removed unused session fields: recentCommands, recentDecisions, summary, nextAction
- Updated HODGE.md generation to use WorkflowContext from context.json
- Modified 7 files with 138 insertions, 31 deletions

## Why This Change
The /hodge command was unexpectedly loading feature context when no feature was specified, due to session-aware fallback behavior (const feature = featureArg ?? session?.feature). This "magic" behavior confused users who expected to load only global context when starting new work.

Additionally, the codebase maintained two separate session management systems (SessionManager reading .hodge/.session and ContextManager reading .hodge/context.json) that duplicated responsibility and created maintenance overhead. Both tracked feature and mode, creating confusion about the source of truth.

This change makes feature loading explicit and predictable:
1. /hodge (no args) → loads global context only
2. /explore "description" → creates feature, updates context.json
3. /build (no args) → reads feature from context.json
4. /hodge HODGE-XXX → explicitly loads that feature's context

## Impact
- Eliminates confusion about session state - context.json is now the single source of truth
- Simplifies codebase by removing ~200 lines of duplicate session management code
- Makes feature loading explicit rather than magical
- Improves predictability of /hodge command behavior
- Reduces maintenance burden by eliminating dual session systems
- Aligns with CLI Architecture Standard: commands should be explicit, not magical

Test Results:
- All 1364 tests passing
- Zero TypeScript errors
- Zero ESLint errors  
- Duplication: 0.34% (acceptable)
- 14 acceptable warnings (TODOs, function length)
- 1 architectural warning (claude-commands.ts orphan - known issue)

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
